item.description:
Kaela will not be present at this event but will share the attendance list with Lydia, our Citizens Schools contact.

Citizen Schools is a national nonprofit that partners with middle schools to expand the learning day and increase opportunities for low-income children. Citizen Schools is currently recruiting volunteers to teach 12-week hands-on apprenticeship courses that build students' skills and fuel their imaginations. Volunteers receive up-front training, weekly lesson-plan support, and work with a group of 15 students for 90 minutes each week, with a trained staff member to support you in the classroom at one of Citizen Schools’ Boston or New Bedford area schools.

Interested in learning more? Attend the Citizen Schools Meet and Greet! Learn more about Citizen Schools and how you can get involved while meeting other Bostonians invested in making a difference. There will be a brief informational session around 6:00 and Citizen Schools staff members present the whole time to answer any questions you have.

Who: You!
What: Citizen Schools Meet and Greet!
When: Thursday, August 9th, 5:30-7:30pm
Where: The Black Rose, 160 State St. Boston MA

Ready to sign up today? If this opportunity to deeply impact a group of middle school students for a semester interests you, fill out a brief interest form http://www.citizenschools.org/volunteer/sign-up/ and a staff member will contact you to share more information, discuss possible topics, and you can see if it’s right for you.

This special volunteer opportunity is provided for you by a partnership with:

The Boston Volunteers
Learn more: http://www.meetup.com/bigenoughtodeliver/

And The Boston Spanish Language Meetup.
Learn more: http://www.meetup.com/bostonspanish/

group.name: The Boston Spanish Language Meetup Group

item.name: Are you interested in Teaching Spanish?
